term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - branching chain reaction
term.title: branching chain reaction

item.text: A chain reaction which includes a propagation step or steps in which there is an increase in the number of active intermediates; for example, [image: Not defined] is a branching reaction since one active intermediate ( H ) gives rise to two ( OH and O ).

sources.item: PAC, 1981, 53, 753. 'Symbolism and Terminology in Chemical Kinetics' on page 762 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac198153030753)
